Extension of duty to provide careers guidance in schools
	Section 42A of the Education Act 1997 (duty to provide careers guidance inschools in England) is amended as follows.
	In subsection (1) for “the relevant phase of their education” substitute“their secondary education”.
	In subsection (2) after paragraph (c) insert—
		an Academy school;
		an alternative provision Academy.”
	In subsection (3) after paragraph (b) insert—
		in the case of an Academy school or an alternative provision Academy, theproprietor.”
	After subsection (4) insert—
		“(4A)Subsection (4)(b) does not apply in relation to pupils over compulsoryschool age.”
	Omit subsection (6).
	In subsection (7) omit the definition of “class”.
Consequential amendments
	In section 43(6) of the Education Act 1997 (careers education in Welshschools) for the definition of “class” substitute—
		  * ““class”, in relation to a pupil, means—
		the teaching group in which the pupil is regularly taught, or
		if the pupil is taught in different groups for different subjects, such one ofthose groups as is designated by the head teacher of the school or, in thecase of a pupil at a pupil referral unit, by the teacher in charge of theunit;”.
	In section 46(1) of that Act (power to extend scope of certain provisions)omit—
		“42A,”; 
		“42A(6),”. 
	The Careers Guidance in Schools Regulations 2013 ([S.I.2013/709](/id/uksi/2013/709?view=plain "Go to item of legislation")) arerevoked.
Extent, commencement and short title
	This Act extends to England and Wales.
	Sections 1 and 2 come into force on such day or days as the Secretary ofState may by regulations made by statutory instrument appoint.
	This section comes into force on the day on which this Act is passed.
	This Act may be cited as the Education (Careers Guidance in Schools) Act2022.
